pullRequest.title: [Issue 5720][authorization provider] Add granularity
pullRequest.bodyText:
Fixes #5720
Motivation
Provide "real" authz abilities to pulsar resources.
Modifications
Add stuff to AuthorizationProvider interface, and use them on every pulsar resource management auth (tenant, namespace, topics, functions, connectors, ...)
Verifying this change

 Make sure that the change passes the CI checks.

This change added tests and can be verified as follows:
Will add specified test.
Documentation

Does this pull request introduce a new feature? yes
If yes, how is the feature documented? not documented (yet, will do)

beforeCommit.message: order in a more meaningful way

afterCommit.message: order in a more meaningful way

beforeCommit.message:
Revert "add servercnx authz"

This reverts commit 9fc963e842c3d5b7ae7278e7ba6f245bac0ad910.

nodes.bodyText: In my opinion we should reduce these operations otherwise things will get out of hand. Any SET_ could just be Update or Write. Any GET_ could just be Read or Get. Same for the others below. My concern is things will get out of hand and these lists will be very difficult to maintain. Is there a way to group the operations to reduce the number? These are just needed for authorization right?

First, it is "subscription auth mode" not "auth mode".
Secondly, it is a policy not a verb to a namespace resource.

nodes.bodyText:
I think NamespaceBundle is a resource not a verb.
The verb (operation) to the namespace bundle is:

get: get the bundle data
delete: delete a bundle
add: add/split a bundle.
